messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Good books...
messages.msgSnippet: *** Does anybody have any book suggestions?  My kids are ages 3 and 4....*** We really liked Making Things: The Handbook of Creative Discovery by Anne Sayre
messages.messageBody:
*** Does anybody have any book suggestions? My kids are ages 3 and
4....***

We really liked "Making Things: The Handbook of Creative Discovery" by
Anne Sayre Wiseman.

Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Good books...
messages.msgSnippet: I just ordered a build a village and build a train books from Dover Books, and my 4 and 6 year-olds are very excited. It s hard, though, for them to wait
messages.messageBody:
I just ordered a "build a village" and "build a train" books from Dover
Books, and my 4 and 6 year-olds are very excited. It's hard, though, for
them to wait for the glue to dry.

:-) Diane

>project to do together, like a fun science experiment. Does anybody have
>any book suggestions? My kids are ages 3 and 4....
>
>Thanks!

messages.subject: Good books...
messages.msgSnippet: Hey everybody...I just got a gift certificate from Amazon.  I really should spend it on myself (ha!), but also would really like some great homeschool
messages.messageBody:
Hey everybody...I just got a gift certificate from Amazon. I really should
spend it on myself (ha!), but also would really like some great homeschool
activity-type books. My kids love it when I come up with some sort of
project to do together, like a fun science experiment. Does anybody have
any book suggestions? My kids are ages 3 and 4....

Thanks!

Erika :)
